name: Spiderplan
body: # What is SpiderPlan? SpiderPlan is a constraint-based planning framework that allows inclusion of many different types of knowledge into automated planning. It also features execution and comes with an interface to the Robot Operating System (ROS). # Featured Constraint Types & Solvers - Statements - State-variable assignment attached to flexible temporal interval - Goals - Domain constraints - Temporal constraints - Reusable resources - Prolog - Costs - Math constraints (simple calculations) - Set constraints (simple) - Interaction Constraints - Used for social acceptability, proactivity and context-awareness in Human-aware Planning - ROS - Publish variables to ROS - Subsribe to ROS topics - Make variables ROS goals (actionlib) - Use ROS service calls # Dependencies & Requirements The following libraries will be fetched from maven when running gradle: - JUnit (link) - Jung Graph Library (link) Apart from that Python 2.x is required by some scripts (e.g. for ROS) and YAP Prolog (link) is used to solve Prolog constraints. # Installation & Test 1) Compile with gradle (will download all maven dependencies): ''' ... ''' # Solving a problem To solve a problem three things need to be provided: - A domain definition (.uddl) - A problem definition (.uddl) - A planner definition (.spider) # Sponsors * Örebro University * The Swedish Research Council (Project: Human-aware task planning for mobile robots) * The Swedish Knowledge Foundation (Project: ecare@home)
